metadata.title: CVE-2020-12422 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In non-standard configurations, a JPEG image created by JavaScript couldhave caused an internal variable to overflow, resulting in an out of boundswrite, memory corruption, and a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 78.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
